title: Exercise 3: Sensor Panel Bitmask Reporter
description: Analyse a 4-bit security panel mask using shifts and bitwise operators without relying on enumerations.

tests.name: mask_5
tests.description: Mask 5 reports front and side sensors as open
tests.expected:
Mask: 5
Binary: 0101
Front Door Open: Yes
Back Door Open: No
Side Door Open: Yes
Garage Door Open: No

tests.name: mask_10
tests.description: Mask 10 reports back and garage sensors as open
tests.expected:
Mask: 10
Binary: 1010
Front Door Open: No
Back Door Open: Yes
Side Door Open: No
Garage Door Open: Yes

hints: Store each sensor mask in a constexpr unsigned int so the bit positions remain self-documenting.
Convert the input to std::bitset<4> to produce the binary line.
Use (mask & FRONT_DOOR_MASK) != 0 to decide whether to print Yes or No.
Ensure spacing and capitalisation match the expected output exactly.
